name: sfchronicle
text:
COVID-19 hospitalizations rose slightly in the Bay Area as local health departments recorded 693 patients as of August 14, an increase of 16 from the day before.

Hospitalizations across California fell slightly to 5,112 on Saturday, a decrease of 77.

name: sfchronicle
text:
BREAKING: PG&E blacks out power to 220,000 customers Saturday night in the second day of outages amid a heat wave that continues to strain the state's energy grid. 

Affected homes and businesses are in parts of the Central Coast and Central Valley. https://t.co/ZAw2LuV4s3

name: sfchronicle
text:
Down to their last strike at Oracle Park, the A‚Äôs did their thing again, as Mark Canha whacked a last-second homer to give Oakland the win over the Giants, 7-6. The A‚Äôs improved to a league best 15-6. 

@SusanSlusser has the latest: https://t.co/orjC7OzszL

name: sfchronicle
text:
In a frightful rerun, the Giants incomprehensibly gave up a three-run advantage and lost 7-6 to the A's on Saturday. With the same pitcher on the mound, giving it up the same way, with another defensive mistake making it possible.

Story by @HankSchulman: https://t.co/xtHK1LntjS

name: sfchronicle
text:
Matt Olson is a home-run hitter. Recently, he has been only a home-run hitter.

name: sfchronicle
text:
As the Loyalton Fire, north of Tahoe, grew amid extreme heat and intense winds, it sent up a tall column of smoke that appears to have formed into a fire-fueled tornado ‚Äî similar to the one seen during the 2018 Carr Fire in Redding.

https://t.co/Suiow1cx6h

name: sfchronicle
text:
Update: PG&E says it has restored electricity to most customers affected by rolling outages in the Central Coast and Central Valley. The outages, prompted by a massive heatwave straining the state's energy grid, lasted around three hours. 

https://t.co/ecmuxHjd65

name: sfchronicle
text:

name: sfchronicle
text:
The coronavirus has turned prisons into hot zones, killing incarcerated people and staff, straining hospital resources and putting entire communities at risk. 

The solution to this problem is simple yet radical: Release 50,000 people. @JFagone reports: https://t.co/7ettoG0WWT

name: sfchronicle
text:
If the departures continue at the current pace, the SF Police Department is on track to lose nearly twice as many cops this year as it did last year and close to four times as many as in 2018. 

@philmatier has the story >> https://t.co/dDXeec65uX

text:

Researchers tested 14 different types of common face coverings to determine which work best to stop the transmission of respiratory droplets and coronavirus during regular speech ‚Äî and which are practically useless.

name: sfchronicle
text: In the wake of the deaths of disproportionately Black and brown lives by police, Berkeley has emerged as a potentially radical model for re-imagining the role of the police. But what can it look like? @RyanKost asked leaders and advocates for answers: https://t.co/k8HuHeKEux

text: Emile DeWeaver‚Äôs experience suggests that a violent act doesn‚Äôt freeze someone in amber, that an offender is more than just the offense, and he says he‚Äôs not an exception. During the pandemic, California has a choice to alter people‚Äôs fates: https://t.co/IYU1zi1a21
